title: Amethyst verified
author: GDN
content: After a long time the top 2 player on the demon list wPopoff verified the level Amethyst. It would eventually be the top 1 level on the demon list.

title: When will 2.21 come out?
author: GDN
content:
On July 18, RobTop announced the Random Gauntlet Contest. However, the Gauntlet textures for this contest are currently not in the game. This means that Geometry Dash 2.21 might release on November 16, 2025, and that it would also include the Gauntlet sprites for the contest.
There are a lot of things that 2.2 didn't have and gotdelayed to 2.21: the Map, Versus Mode, icons, the new level 'Explorers' and of course the Random and Chance gauntlets. There are also a lot of things RobTop said would 'come soon' to the Tower, main levels and some other ones. These are also thought to be uploaded in 2.21.

title: Cuatrocientos died at 99% on FlameWall
author: GDN
content: On August 31 2025 the player Cuatrocientos, who is trying to verify the 7-minute long level FlameWall, died at 99%. Many players are sad because of how tragic this is due to its long time and that if he verified it, it would probably be top 1 on the demon list, beating the current hardest level, Amethyst

title: Zoink face revealed in front of 5K people
author: GDN
content: On 12 September the top player Zoink face revealed on a live stream on YouTube while 5K people were watching. Zoink was known for being one of the few players who has not shown his face yet.

title: Thinking Space II rated
author: GDN
content: On September 19, 2025 the level Thinking Space II by Cairox finally got rated by RobTop. This level is a sequel to the very popular Thinking Space. It is also currently the hardest level in the game according to the demonlist, surpassing the former hardest Amethyst. The level got rated after Zoink verified it on 25 May 2025, the same day as Amethyst. Amethyst got rated almost instantly by RobTop but Thinking Space II took a long time to get rated. Many people are happy that this level finally got rated because according to Zoink and a lot of other players, Thinking Space II is harder than Amethyst.

title: Where is Cuatrocientos?
author: GDN
content: Cuatrocientos, the player who is trying to verify the 7-minute long level FlameWall, has not been streaming the past days. Many people are wondering where he is and why he hasn't been online for a while. Some think he might be taking a break from the game, while others think he might be working on something big. Only time will tell where Cuatrocientos is and when he will return to the game. He has not been active on social media neither, which has led to more speculation about his whereabouts. Fans are eagerly awaiting any news about his return and are hoping that he will be back soon to continue his quest to verify FlameWall. He already got 99% on the level twice, so many people are excited to see if he can finally complete it and achieve his goal.

title: FlameWall verified!
author: GDN
content: Yesterday, September 21 2025, the player Cuatrocientos would verify the 7-minute long level Flamewall. He died on 99% on the level twice, so this was a huge accomplishment. The level Thinking Space II got rated on 19th September, and got placed first on the demon list, but many players think now that Cuatrocientos verified FlameWall, it will replace the top level on the demon list.

title: FlameWall rated!
author: GDN
content: on september 25, 2025, the level FlameWall got rated by RobTop. This level is now the hardest level in the game, above Thinking Space II. Many people are happy that it finally got rated because according to many players, FlameWall is harder than Thinking Space II, even thought it is now rated for just a few hours. A lot of players are happy to see the level being rated just 3 days after Cuatrocientos verified it, while Thinking Space II took months after Zoink verified it.

author: GDN
content:
These are all of the wraith vault codes in 2025:

To get to the Wraith Vault, you need to go to the Tower, and then on the right bottom corner you should see something that looks like the Cursed Thorn. Click on it and you should see the Wraith. Have fun!

title: Streamer Vortrox beat Yatagarasu!
author: GDN
content: On October 1, 2025, the popular streamer Vortrox beat the level Yatagarasu, which is known for being one of the hardest levels in Geometry Dash. Vortrox has been streaming his attempts to beat the level for weeks, and his fans have been cheering him on every step of the way. After many failed attempts and close calls, Vortrox finally managed to complete the level and achieve his goal. His stream was filled with excitement and celebration as he shared the moment with his viewers. Many people congratulated Vortrox on his achievement and praised his dedication and perseverance in beating such a challenging level. This is a major accomplishment for Vortrox and his fans, due to his problems with his great-grandmother passing away recently.

title: New event level Eta Carnis
author: GDN
content: ETA Carnis became the 19th Event level in the popular game Geometry Dash, succeeding FUNHOUSE. This level is unique as it has been classified with a Mythic rating and is also noted for its Halloween theme. The level is the first mythic 6 star. It is a mega-collaboration and the host is GloryEX.

title: A new update wil come over 1 month
author: GDN
content: Today, October 16 2025, we are exactly 31 days away from a new update to GD, because on 16 November 2025 the Random and Chance gauntlet will come out. Players quickly found that the sprites for the gauntlets were not yet in the files. So there will be an update on 16 November. There is a chance RobTop makes the sprites server-side, but the chances are low. We are just going to have to wait.

title: EVW beat Sonic Wave!
author: GDN
content: EVW is one of the most popular GD content creator. He decided to try to beat RGB, a list that contains the top 3 levels back in 2017 on the demonlist. RGB consists of Yatagarasu, Erebus and of course Sonic Wave. EVW already beat Yatagarasu and Erebus, so it was cool to see him beat the last level Sonic Wave, which is the hardest one of the 3.

title: Bencar face revealed!
author: GDN
content: The player Bencar, who owns with NotVixios the channel SecretWayGD, was livestreaming his progress on Zodiac when he said that if he got 100 dollars he would face reveal. Not even a minute later someone donated 100 dollars and Bencar face reveald on the spot. Now a new meme appeared in the community, because he looks like Npesta.

title: Nullscapes hackers are everywere!
author: GDN
content:
Nullscapes is a level made by Kiba and verified by Zoink. It is the sequel to Shardscapes. Since Zoink verified it, it has been placed 4th on the demonlist, but nobody else has beaten it yet.
Because the level is so hard and everybody wants to see someone beat it, there are a lot of hackers in Nullscapes. The player Danielcookie was seen as the best mobile GD player, and he said he beat Nullscapes very easy. This grew some suspicion on his friend who made a copy of Danielcookie's level and it was just too easy, like something felt wrong. The friend went in the editor and found a lot of invisable option triggers under the level.
There are also some other hackers. CookieIsMine was seen as one of the best players in Nullscapes, but it was later found he was playing 'Nullscapes hold'. He confessed to doing this on Twitter on 16 October 2025, after the Demonlist moderators supposedly forced him to, because he had been posting fake progress on his Twitter account. On top of that, his Pointecrate account has been banned for three months. CookieIsMine also provided that Secret Way's video about his notable progress made him feel guilty, causing him to make his faked runs more obvious, and finally playing the level with an Elmo costume. Despite faking his runs, CookieIsMine has made legitimate progress on the level of 44-80% and 63-100%, saying that he really wants to beat the level in the future.

title: Vortrox verified a new extreme demon!
author: GDN
content: After beating Yatagarasu on stream, the streamer and content creator Vortrox took a break from playing and went to NYC for a trip. Despite this, on August 21, 2025, Vortrox would announce he would try to verify a new extreme demon called 'Fallen Horizon', a megacollab with great decoration. He would get 69% on the level after just 2 hours of playing. Nice! He would quickly get 80% after that and then verified the level after just 1700 attempts!

title: Nullscapes just got its first legit victor!
author: GDN
content: Yesterday, the player spookkd would be the first victor of Nullscapes. The level was verified by Zoink and since then players are trying to beat the level. Even thought a few of players said they did it, they were later exposed for hacking.

title: Flamewall got placed on the demonlist!
author: GDN
content: After exactly 1 month of Flamewall being rated, the level got placed on the demonlist at place 3, after Amethyst and before Tidal Wave. The level was originally verified by Cuatrocientos. It lasts over 7 minutes.

title: Random gauntlet deadline got extended
author: GDN
content: On november 3rd, 2025, RobtopGames would post on YouTube and Discord that the deadline for the Random gauntlet will be moved from November 16 to December 14. This would give creators more time to finish their levels. The submissions were according to RobTop low but a lot of people asked to move the deadline. This also means that our theory about the update that would come, will also be later that expected. The levels that will win will be in game on December 20, 2025, 4 PM EST. Then the update would probably come out. In RobTop's own words he said: 'This extension was given due to more creators than usual requesting more time to finish their level, which is also noticeable in the relatively low number of entries. It makes sense that making an entry for this contest takes more time because of the randomization rule, which means that you may have to make several versions of parts of your level.' You can view the full YouTube post here .

title: Vortrox beat Low Death!
author: GDN
content:
Vortrox announced that he would take on Low Death, an extreme demon that has become infamous for taking an astonishing five years to verify. This is noteworthy because it reflects his confidence and skill, as this is the fewest attempts he has ever put into an extreme demon. On November 7, 2025, he successfully completed Low Death after a total of 7,132 attempts.
What makes this level particularly challenging are its many difficult sections that require not just skill but also precise timing and quick reflexes. In addition to these hard parts, Low Death is packed with hidden easter eggs, which reward players for exploring and can add unexpected surprises to the gaming experience. Vortrox's accomplishment not only highlights his dedication, but also serves as an inspiration to others in the gaming community looking to tackle their own difficult challenges.

title: Zoink almost beat Flamewall
author: GDN
content:
On November 2nd, 2025, Zoink made an exciting announcement that he would rebeat the entire main list of levels, which includes the newly added level Flamewall. This initiative thrilled his fans and the gaming community, as it showcased his dedication to mastering every challenge presented. The anticipation built up as players eagerly awaited updates on his progress.
On November 16, Zoink hosted a live stream where he played through Flamewall. During the stream, he achieved a new personal best of 63%, a significant milestone that demonstrated his skill and determination. However, the excitement didnâ€™t stop there. Shortly after reaching that impressive percentage, Zoink pushed himself further and managed to score 68%. This feat tied him with another prominent player, zLevii, who was the first to achieve a world record of 68% on the same level about a month ago.
And then Zoink didn't felt like it was enough, because then he finished a run from 16-100%, breaking the previous record of 24-97%.

title: What will come in 2.21?
author: GDN
content:
2.21 is speculated to release on December 20 2025, 4pm EST. We will see what will come in this update here.

The main level that should have came out in 2.2 was Explorers, but it got delayed to 2.21. This would finally release.
The Map would come out. It would be something like GD World, but with user made platformer levels.
Alongside with the Map, Versus Mode is also a button that is in the game, but is still delayed. It should be a kind of multiplayer competition mode.
The Random and Chance gauntlet will come out. These were the ones that gave us the day the update would come out, because the images are not in the files yet.
And of course, the icons. There were a lot of icons that would come out in 2.21.

Now we just think 2.21 will come out then, but there are a few different things that could happen. There is a chance the update would just add the gauntlets, and be update 2.208 or something.

title: Zoink died at 99% in Flamewall
author: GDN
content:
Zoink has been playing the top 3 level Flamewall for a short time, but is already the best player after its verifier Cuatrocientos. Just 1 week ago Zoink would get 68%, which was the world record at the time, tied with zLevii. He also got a run of 16-100% that same stream.
But in Zoink's last stream he got to 99%, the place where Cuatrocientos died twice, and the curse stayed because Zoink died at 99.5% in the level.

title: Zoink's next verification level!
author: GDN
content: The creator and host of some of the most populair levels, MindCap, just published the showcase of Orbit, a level were every click is an orb. On January 7 2023 MindCap gave the layout of the level and on November 5 2025 he announced the verifier would be Zoink. Zoink is probably going to beat the level after he finishes Flamewall, the level where he got 99% on just a week ago.

title: Zoink beat Flamewall!
author: GDN
content: After Cuatrocientos verified Flamewall, a top 3 demon, it had no victors for about 3 months. There were 3 players who stated they wanted to be the first victor: zLevii, w3rty and Zoink. zLevii got the record of 68% about a month ago and since then Zoink started playing the level. He quickly got to the same 68% where zLevii died. But only a few days later Zoink would get 99%, the spot where Cuatrocientos, the verifier, died twice. On December 4th 2025 Zoink tweeted that he beat Flamewall after 11745 attempts and 63 hours of gameplay.

title: Boobawamba got its first victor!
author: GDN
content: Boobawamba is a top 6 level on the demon list and has the world record for the longest time a list demon has gotten without a first victor, surpassing the previous record holder Nullscapes. The level has not got any victors for over a year. EastShark was its verifier. The level has a lot of memory parts, and most players tought somebody like Zoink or wPopoff would be the first victor. Today the player Agonom beat the level after over 92 000 attempts.

title: The demonlist is making a huge placement swap!
author: GDN
content: The past few days RobTop has been rating new extreme demons and those are added to the demonlist. This is very controversial because now popular extreme demons are falling of the demonlist, like Zodiac is out the top 100, Slaughterhouse is out the top 20 and Limbo is out the top 40. There has been a debate in the community if Amethyst should be top 1 instead of Thinking Space II. But despite this, the demonlist swapped the top 2 level (Amethyst) and the top 3 (Flamewall).

title: The Random gauntlet got extended again!
author: GDN
content: The Random and Chance gauntlet should have come out today but in the GD Discord server was posted that the judging of the levels was complete, but there were some problems rendering the video. The gauntlets would also bring a new update, giving that the their textures are not in the files, but this is just a rumor. RobTop said when he extended the gauntlets first that it would be the last extension. Because an update (probably 2.208) would maybe come out, players are thinking this is just a way that RobTop is hiding the fact his update is not finished

title: The Random gauntlet... soon.
author: GDN
content:
The levels for the Random and Chance gauntlet were revealed on December 23 2025 at 10 PM. The levels where:

'Randomverse' by MinAY & more
'Dronification' by Ivyteal
'Dll' by Galofuf
'Dimension Break' by AbstractDark
'KRYPT OF KRANDON' by LightPotatoDev
'IO' by 7ak
'Fukashigi' by Trms01
'Busted' by Whirl
'Update Disorder' by DangerousROBOT
'Project Novaform' by Dolphe & Gostley

On the endscreen of the video stood 'The Gauntlets will be available in-game soon', which is just RobTop being RobTop. Here at GDN we still believe there will be an update when the gauntlets will come in game. This is because the texture for the Random and Chance gauntlet are not in the files yet.

title: Orbit is becoming harder than we thought.
author: GDN
content: Around a month ago, the host of Orbit said the level would be top 10 difficulty. The verifier Zoink is known for buffing his verifications most of the time, but Mindcap said Zoink couldn't change the level without his permission. However, since Zoink has been itching to buff the level, Mindcap gave him permission to buff the level. If this happens more often and if Zoink adds even more buffs we could see a new potentially top 5 level on the demonlist.

title: Orbit is NOT becoming harder than we thought.
author: GDN
content: A few days ago, we said that Zoink would be buffing Orbit, but he posted a short on his YouTube channel where he said that some clicks were way too easy and some way too hard. He said he was actually just balancing the gameplay a bit.

title: SpaceUK beat Acheron legitimately!
author: GDN
content:
SpaceUK is the biggest cheater in the history of Geometry Dash. His first demon was Decode, an easy demon. After that he jumped to the insane demon Windy Landscape. It was the first time a player had beaten an insane as his second demon. After that, he beat Leyak, wich was also an insane demon. He then beat Wasureta, an extreme demon, as his fourth demon. The community was hyped to see such a skilled player breeze trough demons. Some people where thinking that his completions could be hacked, but when SpaceUK beat The Golden as his fifth demon, a top 2 extreme at the time, the community went wild. SpaceUK swiftly beat the top hardest demons in record time, with an average of one per day. He joined the Slaughterhouse verification race in October 2021, completing the verification process in just over a week, on 24 October 2021.

He later completed the entire main list, as marked by completing Sephiroth on 7 May 2022, becoming the second player after nSwish to do so. However, on 19 June 2022, SpaceUK privatised most of his videos, deactivated his Twitter account, and requested a removal of his Pointercrate profile, claiming that he had become disinterested in the game. Following the backlash, he reinstated his videos and reactivated his social media accounts the day after, with Pointercrate restoring his profile two weeks later. In the following nine months, he beat many of the hardest levels in impressively low attempt counts, reportedly becoming the first victor of Aerial Gleam, Abyss of Darkness, and Acheron. He also claimed to hold the record for the lowest attempt count on Kyouki with roughly 13,500 attempts. In early 2023, he was chosen to verify the Top 1 level Banshee, an old impossible level built by Komp in 2014 that was picked up by Nikrodox and revamped. On 28 March 2023, he posted a 60% run, showing rapid progress. However, on 1 April 2023, his progress videos were unlisted, and he declared his abandonment of Banshee on social media. This left followers questioning whether it was an April Fools' prank or a genuine exit from the verification.

But in April 2023 everything changed when the player Paqoe posted a video titled 'exposing SpaceUK'. In the video he explained SpaceUK used zBot to cheat. zBot is a showcase bot where you beat the level in practice and then the bot plays the level in normal mode using the successful attempts of the practice runs. zBot also added fake clicks, but these are a few frames off. This is how Paqoe exposed SpaceUK. SpaceUK was also found guilty of hacking his other accomplishments due to an easter egg the creator of zBot added. SpaceUK confessed and deleted his channel and was not seen again until the start of 2025 when he would come back as BirdUK and be legit. He beat a few of his levels legitimately like The Golden but today he beat Acheron, for real this time.

title: WorldGames got exposed for cheating!
author: GDN
content:
WorldGames is a popular GD player and content creator known for his series where he beat every main levels blindfolded. He was known for being the player with the highest attempt count on a single level: Clubstep, with around 2 million attempts. There were other players who played blindfolded, but WorldGames was one of the more popular ones and was respected by the community.

But 2 days ago, Treble made a video where he explained a method called masking. Masking is a video editing technic where you can put a layer over a video to hide certain parts. WorldGames filmed 2 separate videos: one where he just plays the level normally and one where he is blindfolded, but doesn't play the level. Then he would mask the part where he plays the level in the blindfolded video with the part where he plays normally. This way it looks like he is playing blindfolded, when in reality he is not.

It was even more obvious because WorldGames made a lot of videos like GD IRL where you can see his editing skills. When looking at the videos you can sometimes see that a piece of finger is cut of but then back the next frame. Or in other videos you can see the attempt counter on the screen.

This is not confirmed yet by WorldGames. We recommend watching Treble's video to see the proof yourself: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fwaibDYuj2I.

title: GD 2.208 is out!
author: GDN
content:
When the Random and Chance gauntlets were revealed, players found that the textures were not in game yet. This meant that the game would have to be updated for the gaunltets to be playable. We made articles about this. The community realized that an update would come because there were a lot of missed deadlines. First the deadline got moved, then the results video and then we had to wait a long time before it came in the game.

Today, January 19th 2026, the update finally came out. It added the Random and Chance gauntlet, a few bugfixes and some other small changes like the leaderboard now also filtering on coins, demons, and moons, a feature the community has been asking for a long time. There is also a built-in Click Between Frames, a feature that was only a mod before. The update is called 2.208. There are still a lot of things that are missing that where said to come in 2.21, like Explorers, Versus Mode and the Map. We will have to wait and see when these will come. RobTop said he is now in full development of a new update and that update 2.209 will follow soon with additional community-requested features.

Update: 2.2081 is out! it fixed a few little bugs. Robtop was also active online and said 2.209 would be very big.

title: GD 2.208 is out on mobile!
author: GDN
content: After the PC version of Geometry Dash 2.208 came out on January 19th, 2026, players were wondering when the mobile version would come out. Today, January 29th 2026, the mobile version finally came out. It has all of the features of the PC version, including the Random and Chance gauntlet, the built-in Click Between Frames and the new leaderboard filters. Now mobile players can also enjoy the new features that were added in this update. Mobile players where not happy that it took so long, but are happy the update is finally here.

title: Zoink got 99% on orbit!
author: GDN
content:
The best player Zoink has been verifing Mindcap's newest project Orbit, a level where every click is an orb, for about one and a half month now. Zoink previously got 73% on the level, but when he started streaming again after not playing for 4 days he got 93%. But at the end of orbit you have a lot of teleport orbs, where you need to click on the correct one. After that there comes a ball pit and if your icon falls in it means you clicked the wrong orb.

When playing the level Zoink got a good consistansy and quickly got to 93%. A bit after that he passed that part he got to the hard teleport orbs part where he sadly failed at 99%. Players hope that Zoink verifis it soon.
